message: I've made the Zombie Help ( bit.ly/zombiehelp ) app using phonegap and in the process of learning & writing two apps in Obj C. Wishing there was a more booming community to be a part of!
@kevinflo very cool. Keep in mind that you could scale that to every college literary magazine ;]
I'm going to be making my first app ever soon, which will just be an app version of my college's literary magazine.
That's pretty cool, I like the design. Just purchased.
Nice! Mad love for the undead. Snooze Robot - bit.ly/heYNgJ is my latest - Voice activated snooze app! Kinda cheesy/kinda cool is the feedback I've been getting :)
You didn't have to do that! I really do appreciate it though. With phone gap... did you publish on any other platforms?
@kevinflo good luck, would love to see it when you get going
@francois thats exactly why I am sticking to iOS right now. However... I am tempted to try Corona SDK sometime this year.
that looks really promising
@nosebleed that's the idea
I'll be digging into it next week.  Here's to hoping obj c is friendly to a guy that only knows java
New iOS developer here.  Any suggestions for a budding noob?
@ourtechdude what are you working on?
@ourtechdude yes, don't take a week off of learning, you'll totally fuck up your flow (for me at least ha)

I'm still focusing on getting up to speed in Obj C.  I'm starting to dabble in Xcode and Coco  with simple apps but your right @francois, I forget stuff easily if a take too long of a break.  I have a full time job that has nothing to do with programming so I have to force myself to keep learning.  It's been extremely challenging.
The more often you practice, the more you'll remember. I've been learning ruby and obj-c on and off for awhile. I keep forgetting things this way. Keep at it and good luck! I will do the same :)

Hey all, I'm working on an iPad puzzle game called Loop Twister (http://looptwister.com/devblog/).  I've previously made a few utilities like ColorChooser (http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/colorchooser/id397871804?mt=8) or Calczor (http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/calczor/id379844200?mt=8)

I'm new to Convore and to iOS development. Just released my first app, Hashed. Originally meant to "scratch my own itch". It's a native app for PwdHash.com which uses a secret/master password and a website's address to create a hashed password for that site. http://hashedapp.com/

@tylerneylon The more tiles in a loop the more points? Looks like it could be fun. I like the look in the header on the blog where the loop has a "tracer" which livens up the graphics a bit. Reminds me of the Nexus One's default live wallpaper. http://youtu.be/Hz1YBcYw_qE
@d_druska thanks a bunch! have you released anything yet that I can try?

@nnutter Yep, more tiles = more points. I hope to make the goal of the game intuitively meaningful, so it's something you sort of want to do with the pieces anyway if you had complete freedom.  I think this is one reason Tetris has such a universal appeal.  -- Your Hashed app is a good idea!
@nosebleed spread too thin to develop apps right now, but the future looks bright ;)

Yo! New to convore but I've been working with iOS since the sdk was first available. I'm a freelance developer working out of Nagoya, Japan. I'd love to tell you what I'm working on but I have a NDA =P I like to share some of my more generic code on github tho: https://github.com/coryleach
@nosebleed just bought your app, can't wait to try it tomorrow :-D

@nosebleed happy to support indie devs. I haven't yet published outside iOS but I would like to. I don't have any devices available to test on yet, im a little worried about resolution and aspect ratios of all these other devices.
